responses:
theorem Topology.P1_inter_of_open_left
    {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] {U A : Set X}
    (hU : IsOpen U) (hA : Topology.P1 A) :
    Topology.P1 (U ∩ A) := by
  dsimp [Topology.P1] at hA ⊢
  intro x hx
  -- Decompose the hypothesis `x ∈ U ∩ A`.
  have hxU : x ∈ U := hx.1
  have hxA : x ∈ A := hx.2
  -- From `P1` for `A`, obtain membership in `closure (interior A)`.
  have hx_clA : x ∈ closure (interior A) := hA hxA
  -- Show that `x` also lies in `closure (U ∩ interior A)`.
  have hx_clUIA : x ∈ closure (U ∩ interior A) := by
    -- Use the characterization of membership in a closure.
    have hmem : ∀ V : Set X, IsOpen V → x ∈ V →
        ((V ∩ U) ∩ interior A).Nonempty := by
      intro V hV hxV
      -- Since `U` is open and contains `x`, `V ∩ U` is an open
      -- neighbourhood of `x`.
      have hVU_open : IsOpen (V ∩ U) := hV.inter hU
      have hxVU : x ∈ V ∩ U := And.intro hxV hxU
      -- Apply the closure condition for `interior A`.
      have hNon : ((V ∩ U) ∩ interior A).Nonempty := by
        have : ((V ∩ U) ∩ interior A).Nonempty :=
          (mem_closure_iff).1 hx_clA (V ∩ U) hVU_open hxVU
        simpa [Set.inter_assoc, Set.inter_left_comm] using this
      exact hNon
    -- Convert the previous statement into membership in the closure.
    exact (mem_closure_iff).2 fun V hV hxV =>
      (hmem V hV hxV).mono_right (by
        intro z hz
        -- Rearrange intersections to fit the desired shape.
        simpa [Set.inter_assoc, Set.inter_left_comm] using hz)
  -- `U ∩ interior A` is an open subset of `U ∩ A`,
  -- so its closure is contained in `closure (interior (U ∩ A))`.
  have hSubset :
      (U ∩ interior A : Set X) ⊆ interior (U ∩ A) := by
    -- `U ∩ interior A` is open.
    have hOpen : IsOpen (U ∩ interior A) := hU.inter isOpen_interior
    -- It is clearly contained in `U ∩ A`.
    have hIncl : (U ∩ interior A : Set X) ⊆ U ∩ A := by
      intro y hy; exact And.intro hy.1 ((interior_subset : interior A ⊆ A) hy.2)
    exact interior_maximal hIncl hOpen
  -- Use monotonicity of `closure` to upgrade the membership.
  have hx_goal : x ∈ closure (interior (U ∩ A)) :=
    (closure_mono hSubset) hx_clUIA
  exact hx_goal

theorem Topology.interior_inter_open_left
    {X : Type*} [TopologicalSpace X] {A B : Set X}
    (hA : IsOpen A) :
    interior (A ∩ B) = A ∩ interior B := by
  -- We prove the two inclusions separately.
  apply Set.Subset.antisymm
  · -- `⊆` direction
    intro x hx
    -- `x` belongs to `A ∩ B`
    have hxAB : x ∈ A ∩ B :=
      (interior_subset : interior (A ∩ B) ⊆ A ∩ B) hx
    -- Extract the individual facts
    have hxA : x ∈ A := hxAB.1
    -- Monotonicity of `interior` yields `x ∈ interior B`
    have hxIntB : x ∈ interior B := by
      have hsubset : (A ∩ B : Set X) ⊆ B := by
        intro y hy; exact hy.2
      exact (interior_mono hsubset) hx
    exact And.intro hxA hxIntB
  · -- `⊇` direction
    intro x hx
    -- Separate the hypotheses
    have hxA : x ∈ A := hx.1
    have hxIntB : x ∈ interior B := hx.2
    -- Basic facts about `interior B`
    have hOpenIntB : IsOpen (interior B) := isOpen_interior
    have hIntSubsetB : (interior B : Set X) ⊆ B := interior_subset
    -- Consider the open set `V = interior B ∩ A`
    have hVopen : IsOpen ((interior B) ∩ A) := hOpenIntB.inter hA
    have hxV : x ∈ (interior B) ∩ A :=
      And.intro hxIntB hxA
    -- `V` is contained in `A ∩ B`
    have hVsubset : ((interior B) ∩ A : Set X) ⊆ A ∩ B := by
      intro y hy
      have hyIntB : y ∈ interior B := hy.1
      have hyA    : y ∈ A := hy.2
      have hyB    : y ∈ B := hIntSubsetB hyIntB
      exact And.intro hyA hyB
    -- Hence `x` is in the interior of `A ∩ B`
    have : x ∈ interior (A ∩ B) := by
      -- `interior_maximal` turns the inclusion of the open set `V`
      -- into an inclusion in the interior.
      have hsubsetInt : ((interior B) ∩ A : Set X) ⊆ interior (A ∩ B) := by
        apply interior_maximal hVsubset hVopen
      exact hsubsetInt hxV
    exact this
